intro: Millettia oblata subsp. teitensis, commonly known as the Taiti Millettia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the legume family. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
